title: 2017 Ranked placement matches?

embed.description: which begins in 2016. This season we're doing a lot of new things, including moving the start date forward a month, letting you exclude your least-favorite position, introducing two separate ranked ladders (three if you count Twisted Treeline), and giving ongoing updates on queue health for 2017.

body: On the link provided, under "Placements & Seeding", it states you will not be placed higher than you ended 2016 Ranked season. Does this mean if you ended lets say Silver 3 in 2016, no matter how well you do in preseason or placements you can not get placed higher than Silver 3, even though Plat 1 is placements cap? Sorry if this is stupid quesion, I'm pretty new to Ranked xD

replies.body: It's platinum one. During S3, I got placed higher than my previous ranking. I went from Gold 5 to gold 3 straight up. I don't know if it's still 100% the same this year tho.
Okay thanks for some input! I was hoping it wouldn't be like that, but it clearly states it will be. I sure hope not however and thanks again for responding!

In addition to this, ranked games you play during the preseason will have a *small impact* on your placement when the 2017 ranked season starts and you place for the season. Keep on getting that grind on and you should be fine, bud!
Question, On the Client it shows the last seasons ranking as Solo/Duo, and the preseasons as flex. When I do my solo/duo placements next season, which MMR does it pull from?
Please answer me guys ..pre season placement matches are affecting new season placement ?  Or they will reset when new season starts ?
